intro: Misodendrum reflexum var. brevisetaceum, commonly known as the short-setaceous misodendrum, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires a dry, warm climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
